title: blonde_haired_crossdresser_(hokuro_ryuuseigun)
body:
The unofficial name for an [[original|original character]] by [[Hokuro Ryuuseigun]]. Acquainted with [[Brown Haired Crossdresser (hokuro ryuuseigun)|]] and often acts as the [[tsukkomi]] of the pair.

They are an [[otoko no ko]] [[crossdressing|crossdresser]] who enjoys [[josou seme|dominating]] with their [[big penis]]. They have [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] with [[bangs]]. They usually wear a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[grey sweater]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red bow]], [[black skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[green panties]].

title: katia_(isekai_danyuu)
body: Katia is an [[elf]] character from [i][[isekai danyuu:shirudanyuu ga isekai tensei shite ero chishiki full katsuyou de musou danyuu ni naru hanashi|Isekai Danyuu]][/i]. She is an AV star from the alternative world. Her main characteristics are her [[blonde hair]], [[point ears]], [[blue eyes]], [[long hair]], and [[large breasts]]. She generally wears a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress]], a gold [[thighlet]], a gold [[bracer]] on each wrist, and a gold [[headpiece]].

title: super_robot_wars_30
body:
A [[Super Robot Wars]] game released for the series' 30th anniversary. The game was released for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]], and [[computer|PC]] in October, 2021, and has made history by being the first crossover game in the series to see a release in America and Europe.

h1. Original Characters
* [[Edge Sainklaus]]
* [[Az Sainklaus]]
* [[Caruleum Vaull]]
* [[Mitsuba Greyvalley]]
* [[Reynold Hardin]]
* [[Lian Anbird]]
* [[Irene Beclair]]
* [[Miyu Incomes]]
* [[Orchidacea]]

h1. Original Mecha
* [[Huckebein 30]]
** [[Huckebein 30th]]
* [[Gravalin]]
* [[Dreistreger]]

* [[Ultimate Dancouga]] (SRW original upgrade)

In addition to the new original characters, [[Ryuusei Date]] and [[Masaki Andoh]] from [[Super Robot Wars Original Generation]] appear as pre-order bonus guests piloting the [[SRX]] and [[Cybuster]] respectively, while [[Gilliam Yeager]] and his [[Gespenst]] were added as a free update for all players on November 17, 2021, with another free update adding [[Dido (super robot wars DD)|]] and [[Didalion]] from [[Super Robot Wars DD|DD]] on December 22, 2021. A final free update on April 20, 2022 added [[Irmgult Kazahara]] in [[Grungust Ichishiki]], as well as [[Inui Asahi]] and [[Shatte Judevesten]] in [[Van Ein]]. Several other OG characters and [[mecha]] are available through DLC, those being as follows.

* [[Kusuha Mizuha]] in [[RyuKoOh]]
* [[Brooklyn Luckfield]] in [[KoRyuOh]]
* [[Kyousuke Nanbu]] in [[Alteisen Riese]]
* [[Excellen Browning]] in [[Rein Weissritter]]
* [[Sanger Zonvolt]] in [[Dygenguar]]

title: serafuku_to_kikanjuu
body:
[i]Serafuku to kikanjuu[/i] (Sailor Suit and [[submachine gun|Machine Gun]]) is a Japanese novel written by "Jirou Akagawa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jirō_Akagawa, published in 1978. It was well-received and adapted into a comedy/action film of the same name originally released in 1981. It was also adapted into a television program in 1982 and in 2006. 
The 1982 television series stars "Tomoyo Harada":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tomoyo_Harada as the main character, Hoshi Izumi (星泉).

h1. See also
* [[Serafuku to Kikanjuu -Sotsugyou-]]

title: capcom_belt_action
body:
[i][b]Capcom Belt Action[/b][/i], known as [i][b]Capcom Beat ‘Em Up Bundle[/b][/i] outside Japan, is a classic [[video game]] collection published by [[Capcom]] for the [[PlayStation 4]], [[Xbox One]], [[Nintendo Switch]] and [[computer|Pc]] (Steam). 

As the title suggest, it is a bundle of beat 'em up [[arcade]] games developed by Capcom. The collection was officially announced in September 13, 2018 and was released digitally worldwide on September 18 of the same year. 

h4. List of games

* [[Final Fight]] (1989)
* [[Captain Commando]] (1991)
* [[The King of Dragons]] (1991)
* [[Knights of the Round (game)|]] (1991)
* [[Tenchi wo Kurau II]] (1992)
* [[Powered Gear]] (1994)
* [[Battle Circuit]] (1997)

title: seiken_manifestia

Following a successful crowdfunding campaign the same day as its closure, a new version of the game is now under development for distribution through Steam.

title: biting_pear_of_salamanca
body:
A character originating from a surreal painting by the artist [[Ursulav]]. The painting featured a giant [[pear]] with human [[teeth]] being photographed by a small squirrel in a meadow landscape.

The picture eventually caught on with Internet users outside of its home DeviantArt due to the sheer absurdity of the concept, and the pear's slackjawed expression caused people to use it as an image macro, which lead to its moniker of the "lolwut pear".

h4. See also
* post #466611 - original image
* "Page on DeviantArt":http://ursulav.deviantart.com/art/The-Biting-Pear-of-Salamanca-29677500

title: migi_no_ko
body:
h5. Dubbed "Girl on the Right" (右の子)

Started off as a sketch by [[kurata rine]] on his Twitter account about what type of girl he would like to stare at longingly vs. a girl he would like to be with in a relationship.

It sparked a debate among the netizens.

Girl on the right has [[black eyes]] as well as [[black hair]] with [[bangs]]; it is styled into a [[bob cut]]. She wears a yellow short sleeved top and brown [[shorts]].

title: bottle_cap_challenge
body:
A viral internet "challenge" where a person attempts to unscrew or uncap a [[bottle]] using a [[roundhouse kick]] without toppling the bottle over. The origin of the challenge is unclear, but the spread started when Farabi Davletchin, a Kazakh Taekwondo champion, posted a video on Instagram successfully using the roundhouse kick to uncap a bottle and then challenged celebrities to do the same (several celebrities, martial artists, and ordinary folk accepted with varying degrees of success, not necessarily with roundhouse kicks but with other techniques and/or objects).

h4. External links

* "New York Times: The Bottle Cap Challenge Spins Across the Internet":[https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/03/us/bottle-cap-challenge.html]
* "BGR: What the heck is the Bottle Cap Challenge?":[https://bgr.com/2019/07/04/what-is-the-bottle-cap-challenge/]
other_names: ボトルキャップチャレンジ

title: guru_guru_dj_turn!!
body:
Opening theme for the [[D4DJ]] First Mix anime, sung by the members of Happy Around with guest appearances from [[Yamate Kyouko]] and [[Izumo Saki]].

The animation became something of a [[meme]], as the segment where Happy Around's members take turns making [[hip hop]] hand signs at the camera went viral on TikTok and inspired a number of parodies. The viral clip replaced the original song with a remix of Playboy Carti's Magnolia by yxungixxak ("song link":[https://youtu.be/HUmDtLmn9dk])

This tag should be used for posts that feature or parody either the song or the opening animation.

h4. See Also
* "YouTube: 「D4DJ First Mix」OPENING (No Credits)":[https://youtu.be/_wcGvZuF2AE] - official upload of the anime opening 
* Post #5117066 - the segment of the animation that became a meme

title: among_us_eyes_(meme)
body:
An art trend in October of 2022 that has artists using [[crewmate (among us)|]]s from [[Among Us]] to draw crying anime eyes.

Originated from post #5496580, in which Twitter and Discord posts pointed out how [[Junko (touhou)|]]'s eyes look like the aforementioned Crewmate, upon which "other artists started trying it out":[https://twitter.com/NenekHani/status/1572440722661580800].

The trend further expanded to encompass drawing [[how to]]s other than eyes.

h4. External Links

* "Know Your Meme: Among Us Eyes":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/among-us-eyes]

title: jiji_(creature)
body:
Tag for the creature that appears in [[Jiji (aardvark)|]]'s Twitter profile photo and therefore serves as their avatar of sorts; a blue cube-like ghost creature reminiscent of the ghosts in the [[Pac-Man (game)|]] franchise. Fan art, especially ones of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i], has already turned this avatar into a character separate from the artist.

Whenever this creature appears in fan art or art by other known artists, never use "[[artist self-insert]]"; it should be used for its appearances in Jiji's own art per that tag's description. "[[Borrowed character]]" can suffice as an additional tag.

title: rehydrated_ganondorf
body:
A fan variation of [[Ganondorf]] as he appears in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i].

Originating from a "joke":https://twitter.com/furanchu/status/1138546846173843457 by Twitter user furanchu about Ganon's withered corpse being restored if water was given to him. In works depicting him circa [i][[the legend of zelda: tears of the kingdom|Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], he acts as a companion to [[Link]] and [[Princess Zelda]]. This Ganondorf retains his long [[red hair]], but wears little more than a blue [[toga]], [[loincloth]], or waist cloth. He is always depicted with his golden jewelry and headpiece. He will also often be associated with bodies of water.

Note: Pictures merely depicting Ganondorf in his youth/alive shouldn't count as a Rehydrated Ganondorf. Only ones based off of the corpse's appearance and dress should count. A tell-tale sign of a Rehydrated Ganondorf also lies in skin color; canon [i]Tears[/i] Ganondorf has [[green skin]], while most variations of Rehydrated Ganondorf will have the same [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]] as the rest of the [[Gerudo]].

h4. External Links
* "Know Your Meme: Rehydrated Ganondorf":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/rehydrated-ganondorf

title: history_of_japan
body:
""history of japan":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mh5LY4Mz15o]" is a viral video, originally uploaded to YouTube in February 2016 by American artist Bill Wurtz. The video is a bizarre 9-minute-long documentary in which a (mostly) deadpan Wurtz gives a fast-paced satirical retelling of Japanese history from the ancient era all the way up to the 20th century, frequently intercut with very short melodies. In May 2017, Wurtz uploaded a similarly-formatted video with a much broader scope, called ""history of the entire world, i guess":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xuCn8ux2gbs]".

Please do not confuse this with [[Japanese mythology]].

title: sento-kun
body:
せんとくん (Sento-kun) is the official [[mascot]] character for the event being held in Nara prefecture: "Celebrating the 1300th anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital in 2010." He has the appearance of a little boy with deer antlers growing out of his head.
"Nara prefecture":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nara_Prefecture are famous for the [[deer]] that roam the parks, as well as it's many Buddhist [[temple]]s.
(Children are called "Douji" in Buddhist art and are said to have sacred power.)
When his design was first revealed to the public, it received strong criticisms, with people calling him "creepy" and "a desecration of Buddhism." On the contrary, these criticisms ironically became publicity and made him famous.
As data was released of Sento-kun being depicted as a muscular, grown-up man using 3DCG modeling software called "MikuMikuDance," he was called "せんとさん (Sento-san)" in order to differentiate him from the more child-like Sento-kun.

h4.See also

* "Celebrating the 1300th anniversary of Nara Heijo-kyo Capital Official Page":http://www.1300.jp/foreign/english/ 
* "Global Voices Online news article":http://www.globalvoicesonline.org/2008/04/22/japan-love-and-hate-story-of-the-mascot-character-sento-kun/
* Sento-san videos
** NicoNico: http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm9689081
** Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hw30eJ5jvQA
* [[nara mascot]] tag
* [[Renka-chan]]
* [[Hikonyan]]

title: polar_bear_chaos
body:
白熊カオス ([i]Shiro-kuma Chaos[/i], Polar [[bear]] Chaos) is a character appearing in a Playstation 2 game called [[Kuma Uta]] (bear song)." The game was released on November 25, 2003 by SCEI.

In the game, the player writes their own lyrics to "[i]Enka[/i] songs":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enka and teaches them to a polar bear as their pupil. In other words, this game is a singing synthesizer software that was released before [[Hatsune Miku]].

The polar bear can be named to the player's liking. "Polar bear Chaos" is the "pupil" of a player named "Sabu Kitajima," made famous by [[NicoNico]] and YouTube. Fans of Chaos call him "カオス師匠 ([i]Chaos-shishou[/i], Master Chaos)." He often talks about his love for [[loli]] girls, but he most certainly says it as a joke, and it does not mean he is really a [[pedophile]]... probably.

title: obsolete
body:
Obsolete is a [[3D]] animated [[science fiction]] series directed by [[Urobuchi Gen]], featuring music by [[Skrillex]], and released as a YouTube original series. The series consists of 12-minute long episodes, each telling a self-contained story about how humans use the [[EXOFRAME]], a type of basic [[mecha]] frame acquired from a mysterious alien race known as The Peddlers.

The first set of 6 episodes was released in December of 2019, and a second batch was released in December of 2020. Plastic [[model kit]]s based on the series' mecha are released under [[Goodsmile Company]]'s [[Moderoid]] line. The model kit line includes a [[crossover]] kit with [[Soukou Kihei VOTOMS]], which reimagines the iconic [[Scopedog]] as an EXOFRAME variant.

h4. External links
* "Official Site":[https://project-obsolete.com/en/]
* "Watch on YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKPsuBIKuejNJW_M6ArHpD6DBeMIw405L]

title: shoop_da_whoop
body:
A [[4chan]] meme started in 2006 from the [[Dragon Ball Z]] character [[Cell (dragon ball)|]] in blackface shouting “SHOOP DA WHOOP”, “IMMA CHARGIN MAH LAZER”, and/or “IMMA FIRIN MAH LAZER”, typically ending with the firing of said lazer. Though the origin is disputed, Encyclopedia Dramatica claims it to be a Flash animation called “Syntax Error #2”. The meme has been reproduced as both images, motivators and animations.

Noticeable from ""THE":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hSVNbxjdvv8] "LAZER":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZQLKEZzBIZE] "COLLECTION":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d3ZYF-Zmo2E]" videos.

h4. External links

title: shimoneta_to_iu_gainen_ga_sonzai_shinai_taikutsu_na_sekai
body:
[i]Shimoneta: A Boring World Where the Concept of Dirty Jokes Doesn’t Exist[/i]

Light novel series written by Akagi Hirotaka and illustrated by [[shimotsuki_eight|Shimotsuki Eito]]. Adapted into a 2014 manga and 2015 anime series.

In a dystopian future, Japanese authorities are cracking down on anyone caught using any risque language or distributing lewd materials in the country, to the point where all citizens are forced to wear high-tech chokers analyzing their every spoken word. A new high-school student named [[Okuma Tanukichi]] enters the country's leading elite "public morals school" to reunite with his crush and student council President, [[Anna Nishikinomiya]]. However, Tanukichi quickly finds himself entwined with the perverted terrorist "Blue Snow" when she kidnaps and forces him to join her organization, "SOX," in spreading semi-pornographic material across the city.

h4. Characters

title: redaction
body:
Redaction is a form of [[censored text|censoring text]] where portions of text are blacked or whited out or replaced with a word or phrase indicating such, such as "[REDACTED]".  This is to allow the selective disclosure of information in a document while keeping other parts of the document secret. Commonly associated with [[SCP Foundation]] documents.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia - Document redaction":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Document_redaction]

title: ferdinand_marcos
body:
[b]Ferdinand Emmanuel Edralin Marcos Jr.[/b] (September 11, 1917 - September 28, 1989) was the notorious President and dictator of the Philippines, well known for leading the Philippines under Martial Law from 1972 to 1981 while ruling as a dictator for over 20 years. He was toppled from power through the widely known and bloodless People Power Revolution, led by late eventual president Corazon "Cory" Aquino, the wife of his slain rival, [[Benigno Aquino Jr]].

Benigno Jr.'s death along with the electoral fraud during the 1986 elections served as the last straw that triggered the revolt and ouster.

He is survived by his wife Imelda, and his children, among them, Ferdinand "Bongbong" Marcos Jr., his son.

Despite being exiled and their name tarnished, the Marcoses still has a foothold in the Philippine politics, with his son Bongbong being elected as the 17th President of the Philippines in 2022, succeeding [[Rodrigo Duterte]].

h4.External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ferdinand_Marcos]

[b][i]Star Wars: The Bad Batch[/i][/b] is an American animated [[3D]] CGI series created by "Dave Filoni":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Filoni for the streaming service [[Disney+]]. 

It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise, acting as both a sequel to, and spin-off from, the series [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]. The Bad Batch is produced by Lucasfilm Animation, with Jennifer Corbett as head writer and Brad Rau as supervising director.

title: macross_2036
body:
[i][b]Choujikuu Yousai Macross 2036[/b][/i] (超時空要塞マクロス2036), also known as [i][b]Macross 2036[/b][/i], is a Japanese [[science fiction]] console [[video game]] produced by NCS/Masaya and released for the [[Pc Engine]] Super CD-ROM  in April 3, 1992 only in Japan. 

It is a horizontal space shooter, [[mecha]] 2D game set in the [[MACROSS]] universe.

The plot of the game follows the continuity after the events of [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] and before [[Macross 2]], featuring several original characters. 

A companion sci-fi RPG/Turn based strategy simulation video game called [[Macross: Eternal Love Song]] and related to the plot of [i]Macross 2036[/i] was released a few months after this game for the same console.

h4. See also

* [[Komillia Maria Jenius]]

title: clover_clamp
body:
A more extreme variant of [[nipple clamps]], especially suited to [[predicament bondage]] and [[nipple torture]]. A clover clamp is not limited to clamping nipples, although this is the most commonly drawn use in art.

Note: tag uses the singular "clamp" instead of plural form "clamps", since using a single clamp is seen frequently as well. Single clamps are typically for more extreme predicament and [[humiliation]] than for nipple play in [[BDSM]].

(Full entry below includes text originally adapted from Wikipedia. Providing this note for reference to borrowed definition text from the article "Nipple clamp, under the 'Clover clamp' section":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nipple_clamp#Clover_clamp])

The clover clamp, also referred to as "butterfly clamp" or "bird clamp" is of Japanese origin and was designed for clamping sails or sewing fabric. The clamp is flat, about 4 inches (10 cm) long and 2 inches (5 cm) wide, and has an eyelet to which a chain or cord can be attached. If this is pulled a mechanism inside the clamp moves the jaws closer together and provides increasing tension. When they are applied to the nipples a spring hinge holds them in place under tension and provides a very high pain level.They are used for [[nipple torture]] in the BDSM community.

To increase the tension on the nipples, small weights are sometimes attached to the clamps or the chain. These can be weights designed specifically for this purpose or weights such as fishing sinkers can be used.

Another use for the clamps is to keep a person in one place. If a cord is tied from the clamp to a fixed place, the wearer of the clamps cannot move away because the clamps will tighten as they move.

This technique can be used for [[predicament bondage]]. The removal of the clamps is also painful and different methods of removal can increase or decrease this pain.

These clamps have small points of contact and hence their pinch is usually painful, especially on people with larger nipples. They are usually only used by more experienced users for the purposes of [[edging]], [[orgasm denial]] or [[nipple torture]].

title: kaichou_wa_maid-sama!
body:
A 2005 shōjo manga series written by [[Fujiwara Hiro]] and published by Hakusensha's LaLa magazine, later turned into a 2010 anime series by J.C. Staff.

[[Ayuzawa Misaki]] lives a double life. At school she's the strict, man-hating first female Student Council President of Seika High School, a former all-boys school still notorious for its rowdy males, resulting in very few female students. After school, however, she works as a maid at the [[maid cafe|Cafe Latte]]. One day, however, her secret is discovered by impassive and popular [[Usui Takumi]]. Fortunately for her, Takumi decides to keep her career a secret from the rest of the school, and has been visiting the Cafe ever since, with Misaki oblivious to Usui's growing affections for her.

H4. Characters

title: wheatfield_with_cypresses
body: A "Wheatfield with Cypresses":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheat_Field_with_Cypresses] is any of three similar 1889 oil paintings by [[Vincent van Gogh (person)|]], as part of his wheatfield series. The works were inspired by the view from the window at the Saint-Rémy mental asylum where Van Gogh was a voluntary patient from May 1889 to May 1890. The view is of the Alpilles mountains.

title: gewehr_41
body:
A [[World War II]]-era German semi-automatic [b][[rifle]][/b] chambered for 7.92×57mm Mauser [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]], designed in 1941. It was the predecessor of the [[Gewehr 43]]. 
The Gewehr 41 resembles a [[mauser 98|Kar98k]] with a 10-round [[magazine (weapon)|]], two handguard bands, and a [b]straight[/b] bolt handle instead of bent one.

title: vhs-d2
body:
The VHS ([i]Višenamjenska Hrvatska Strojnica[/i], "Multifunctional Croatian Machine Gun") is a 5.56×45mm NATO [[bullpup]] [[assault rifle]] designed and manufactured by HS Produkt of Croatia, and as such is the Croatian Army's service rifle. The VHS-D was the first variant accepted into service in 2009, while the VHS-D2 was an upgraded variant introduced in 2013. The semi-automatic version is imported into the United States as the Hellion by Springfield Armory, Inc.

title: walther_ppk
body:
The [b]Walther PP[/b] ([i]Polizeipistole[/i]) is a double-action semi-automatic [b][[handgun]][/b] of German origin, designed in 1929 and manufactured by Carl Walther GmbH Sportwaffen. Its compact size and blowback operation influenced some pistol designs like the [[Makarov PM]].
Available in different variants, the most prominent one is the shortened [b]Walther PPK[/b] ([i]Kurz[/i]) which is associated with [[James Bond]] franchise.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[PPK (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links

title: chinese_paper-cut
body:
A traditional Chinese folk art dating back to when paper was developed. Because the cut-outs are often used to decorate doors and windows, they are sometimes referred to as "window flowers". Paper cutouts may be done with any color, but red ones are especially used to celebrate festivals like the [[Chinese New Year]], and remains to be a popular New Year activities in the modern days.

h4. See also

* [[kirigami]]
* [[papercraft (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_paper_cutting

title: portrait_of_the_postman_joseph_roulin
body:
"Portrait of the Postman Joseph Roulin":[https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/portrait-of-joseph-roulin-vincent-van-gogh/2QEeaf-2G95y9Q?hl=en&avm=4] was one of a series of portraits of "The Roulin Family":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Roulin_Family] by [[Vincent van Gogh (person)|]].

Vincent was close friends with Joseph Roulin who was the postmaster at the station in Arles. Vincent van Gogh went there frequently to send paintings and letters to his brother "Theo van Gogh":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theo_van_Gogh_(art_dealer)]. Vincent was fascinated by Roulin's face and personality.

title: impressionism
body:
Impressionist art shows life-like subjects painted in a broad quick style, with many short visible brushstrokes that are easily seen and colours that are often bright making up the artwork.

The impressionist art movement was created by "Claude Monet":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Monet], around the year 1860.

H1. See also
* [[Claude Monet (style)]]
* [[Vincent van Gogh (style)]]

title: claude_monet_(style)
body:
Illustrations done in the style of, or referencing "Claude Monet":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Monet] (November 14, 1840 - December 5, 1926), who was a french painter and the founder of the [[impressionism]] art movement, which used short visible brushstrokes to emphasize light. Sometimes confused with Édouard Manet in Japan, especially by amateurs.

His most famous artworks include [[Woman with a parasol]].

body:
Stand power of [[Blackmore]], from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. Catch the Rainbow takes the appearance of a mask with three colored stripes similar to that of a simplified [[rainbow]], along with four mouth slits.

"Catch the Rainbow":[https://jojo.fandom.com/wiki/Catch_the_Rainbow] allows the user to use the rain in various ways. Whether that be melding with it and making your body parts dissappear and materialize. Or stabilizing raindrops in the air for mobility purposes, and or to create an area where the raindrops act as an offensive and defensive barrier. Although this stand can deploy very powerful abilities, it cannot work if there is no rain present.

Its namesake is the [[Rainbow (band)|]] song [i]Catch the Rainbow[/i].
other_names: キャッチ・ザ・レインボー

title: indiana_jones
body:
Dr. Henry Walton "Indiana" Jones, Jr., also known simply as Indy, is the title character and protagonist of the [[Indiana Jones (series)|]] franchise, an explorer archeologist played by [[Harrison Ford]].

Jones is characterized by his iconic accoutrements ([[whip]], [[fedora]], [[satchel]], and [[leather jacket]]), wry, witty and sarcastic sense of humor, deep knowledge of ancient civilizations and languages, and fear of [[snake]]s.

Since his first appearance in Raiders of the Lost Ark, Indiana Jones has become one of western cinema's most famous characters. In 2003, the American Film Institute ranked him the second-greatest film hero of all time. He was also named the greatest movie character by Empire magazine.

title: max_payne_(series)
body:
A neo-noir third-person shooter [[video game]] series developed by Remedy Entertainment (Max Payne and Max Payne 2) and Rockstar Studios (Max Payne 3). The series is named after its protagonist, [[Max Payne]], a New York City police detective [spoiler]turned vigilante after his family was [[murder]]red by drug addicts.[/spoilers]

The games are well-known for their stylized, dramatic bullet time that enables [[slow motion]] montage of enemies experiencing gunshot wounds.

title: four_o'clock_(flower)
body:
The [b]marvel of Peru[/b] or [b]four o'clock [[flower]][/b] ([i]Mirabilis jalapa[/i]), is the most commonly grown ornamental species of [i]Mirabilis[/i] [[plant]]. [i]Mirabilis[/i] in Latin means wonderful and "Jalapa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xalapa is the state capital of Veracruz in Mexico.
The plant is [[bush|shrub]]-like and spreading, with ovate leaf shape. The flowers are trumpet-shaped and opens in the afternoon (hence the "four o'clock" name) until morning. They come in various colours such as [[pink flower|pink]], [[red flower|red]],  [[white flower|white]], [[yellow flower|yellow]] or sometimes bicoloured.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Flowers]]

h1. External links
* "Gardenia.net":https://www.gardenia.net/plant/mirabilis-jalapa

Having found new resolve in her heart, this budding alchemist takes a bold step into the world of summer romance. While various hurdles obstruct her path, she remains unwavering as her sights are set on the one she adores most.

[[Clarisse_(granblue_fantasy)|Clarisse]] in her valentine outfit.

Releasing the feelings from deep within her heart into the form of sweet chocolate on Valentine's Day, this young maiden wants nothing more than to become closer with a special somebody in her life. In order to realize her reveries, she takes her biggest step yet—all under the discerning eye of her master.

An official [[Nijisanji]] [[virtual YouTuber]] duo, comprised of [[Asuka Hina]] and [[Takamiya Rion]]. The duo's name derives from their shared lore as high school students from the same school (Teika High).

[u]Use this tag when:[/u]
* The image mentions the name "Teika-gumi/帝華組", and/or

body:
[[Korwa]] in her swimsuit.

Korwa wishes a beautiful conclusion for all who cross her path, but what of her own happy ending? A summer vacation spent soul-searching on the beach and observing other blissful tales allows this remarkable fashion designer to see that she is already living the happy ending of her dreams.

[[heles|Heles]] in her outfit from the 4th anniversary of [[Granblue Fantasy]].


Alster Island's parliament had this dress commissioned for Heles to participate in formal receptions. Masterful embellishments were added by renowned fashion designer [[Korwa|Korwa]] to highlight Heles's ladylike charm.

title: percival_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
A [[Granblue Fantasy]] character.

Percival is the third of three brothers ([[Lamorak_(granblue_fantasy)|Lamorak]] and [[Aglovale_(granblue_fantasy)|Aglovale]]) born into an aristocratic family. Originally, he served as deputy commander of the Order of the Black Dragons in the Kingdom of Feendrache, but left due to certain circumstances. Since then, he went on a journey to study abroad in order to learn how to build an ideal nation. Percival is unaware of it himself but the inability to stop himself from helping those in need is a part of his nature. It is a habit of his to make up a reason to help others, and he believes that reaching out to the weak is a natural reaction for a person of noble standing. He is curt to others and serious to those he acknowledges.

Both the vast world and its diminutive creatures are equally subject to destruction, thus he wishes to witness the accomplishments of mortals during their brief existence. title: io_(granblue_fantasy)
body:

One of the main supporting characters in the main story. A [[magical girl]] with [[long hair|long]], [[twintails|twintailed]], and mainly [[blonde hair]] that [[gradient hair|gradients]] into [[rainbow hair|various colors]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a dress, black thighhighs, and crystal-like ornaments in her hair. Her in-game art as a character has her complexion as a [[dark skin|dark]] ruddy color, though a majority of her appearances in the "official 4koma":[/pools/9960] depicts her with average Caucasian skin. However her recent 4koma appearances has her skin tone closer to the original art.

title: maximilian_jenius
body:
One of the characters of the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series, the [[Macross 7]] TV series, the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] and the [[Macross Delta: Zettai Live!!!!!!]] movie adaptations, the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA and the [[Macross M3]] [[video game]]. 

[b]Max Jenius[/b] was born in Europe. He is a young fighter pilot, having joined [[Ichijou Hikaru]]'s Vermillion Team, along with [[Kakizaki Hayao]], at the age of only 16. 

Jenius shows in his first sortie that he is a preternaturally talented ace pilot who is near invincible in combat, despite his need to wear corrective lenses on duty. He is quickly recognized as the top pilot of the force, as marked by being granted to distinctively repaint his mecha into his preferred blue color.

His [[mecha]] of choice are the [[VF-1]] (and its [[VF-1A]], [[VF-1J]] and [[VF-1S]] variants), the [[VF-3000]], [[VF-4]], [[VF-9]], [[VF-11]], [[VF-14]], [[VF-22]] and the [[YF-29]]. All are painted in his favorite blue and white color scheme.

In the [[Robotech]] western cartoon adaptation his name was changed to [b]Maximilian Sterling[/b] and his ethnicity to American.

h4. See also

title: chloe_(detroit)
body:
Chloe one of androids of [[Detroit: Become Human]].
RT600 "Chloe" was the first CyberLife android perfected by Elijah Kamski, released in 2021. As the first personal assistant built by CyberLife, she is designed to help humans with everyday tasks such as doing housework and making appointments. She is also the first android to pass the Turing test. By publicly passing face-to-face tests in 2022, Chloe ensured CyberLife's success.

Chloe has long blonde hair in a low ponytail that drapes over her left shoulder, blue eyes, and pale skin. She wears navy eyeshadow with pink lip gloss. Chloe is formally dressed; wearing a dark blue dress that reaches her knees with no shoes. The other Chloes appear to be wearing a two piece light blue bikini.

title: hanami
body:
A traditional Japanese custom of sitting among newly bloomed [[cherry_blossoms|cherry]] or [[plum_blossoms|plum]] [[tree|trees]] in the early spring (ranging from late March through late April from the south to north of Japan's main islands, and in January in Okinawa). It is often accompanied by [[picnic|picnicking]], drinking, and other activities. 

The appeal of viewing tree blossoms itself is found in the very brief period of flowering, which lasts seldom over a week before the petals have all fallen, and the leaves of their trees begin to sprout. This is considered a symbolic motif representing the beauty and impermanence of life. Owing to the cultural significance of the practice, Japan's national weather service keeps an annual forecast to inform the public as to when cherry trees are predicted to blossom. 

Viewing plum blossoms (ume) is an older practice which started in the Nara period, and was eclipsed during the Heian period by the popularity of viewing cherry blossoms. Many older Japanese today prefer ume viewing (sometimes known as 梅見, [i]umemi[/i]), as they find that sakura viewing parties may be too crowded and raucous. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hanami":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hanami

title: particle_cannon_case
body:
Refers to the case that was carried by [[M16A1 (girls' frontline)|]], and later inherited by [[M4A1 (girls' frontline)|]] upon completing her [[M4A1 (MOD3) (girls' frontline)|Neural Upgrade]], in [[Girls' Frontline]].

Under M16, the case didn't serve much of an apparent purpose. It wasn't until M4 inherited it that its powers were revealed, containing a particle cannon within, to be used only under dire circumstances (which gameplay-wise translates to it being skill-activated whenever there's three or less dolls on the field). It's otherwise known as the "Inherited Case" in English, or the "Leftover Case" in Japanese, per the name it has as M4's MOD3 Special Equipment.

title: jiang_shanjiao
body:
One of two [[Virtual YouTuber|Virtual Uploader]] idols created by the [[Communist Youth League of China]], the other being her "younger brother" Hong Qiman. Both their names derive from the poetry of [[Mao Zedong]], Jiang Shanjiao's name being derived from a line in the poem Snow (沁园春·雪) - “how lovely is this land” (江山如此多娇) becoming "Lovable/Lovely Country" (江山娇).

Both VTubers were met with immediate backlash, for a variety of reasons, and Jiang Shanjiao quickly became a symbol of China's endemic misogyny (especially in the face of the 2020 pandemic), as Chinese netizens began asking her the same sorts of questions successful Chinese women are within its borders.

Because of this, only hours after being revealed, both were scrubbed from Weibo and Bilibili.

h4. External links
* ThinkChina: "The short life of patriotic idol Jiangshan Jiao":[https://www.thinkchina.sg/short-life-patriotic-idol-jiang-shanjiao]
* China Digital Times: "Netizen Voices: Weibo Users Mock Communist Youth League’s “Virtual Idols”":[https://chinadigitaltimes.net/2020/02/netizen-voices-weibo-users-mock-communist-youth-leagues-virtual-idols/]
** Grass-Mud Horse Lexicon: "Jiāng Shānjiāo":[https://chinadigitaltimes.net/space/Jiang_Shanjiao]
* Elephant Room: "The Story of Jiangshanjiao":[http://elephant-room.com/2020/02/24/the-story-of-jiangshanjiao-%e6%b1%9f%e5%b1%b1%e5%a8%87/]
* /r/HobbyDrama: "[Chinese Fandom Culture] The epic tale of how a virtual idol created by the Chinese government for propaganda purposes was turned into a feminist icon, in protest against the erasure of female medical workers during the COVID-19 outbreak.":[https://archive.is/QH0zf]
* HMoegirl article: "江山娇与红旗漫":[https://hmoegirl.info/index.php?title=%E6%B1%9F%E5%B1%B1%E5%A8%87%E4%B8%8E%E7%BA%A2%E6%97%97%E6%BC%AB#]

title: hitman_(game)
body:
Stealth video game franchise developed by Danish game developer IO Interactive and formerly published by Eidos (until 2009) and [[Square Enix]] (until 2017).

The series follows [[Agent 47]], a cloned assassin-for-hire, whose flawless record places him in high demand among the wealthy and elite around the world.

The game is about assassinating your targets, either by precise assassinations or mass murdering, although the game rewards you more if you do the precise assassination route.

In [i][[Girls' Frontline]][/i], [[WA2000 (girls' frontline)|]]'s suit is a reference to Agent 47, who carries a WA2000 as his trademark sniper rifle.

A character in [[Minami-Ke]]. She is a classmate of [[Minami Haruka|Haruka]], being a second-year high school student and a member of the volleyball club. She is very quiet.

[b]Atsuko[/b] has [[green eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with [[bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], and [[large breasts]].

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie|red tie]], blue [[blazer]], and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]].

title: monty_oum_(creator)
body:
[b]Monyreak "Monty" Oum[/b] (June 22, 1981 - February 1, 2015) was a web-based American animator and writer who produced videos of crossovers between different series on his own time. He produced [i]Haloid[/i], a [[halo (series)|Halo]] and [[Metroid]] fan video, and [i]Dead Fantasy[/i], an incomplete fighting crossover between [[Dead or Alive]] and [[Final Fantasy]]. Professionally, he was hired by Rooster Teeth to make animations for [i]Red vs. Blue[/i], and created the CGI animation [[RWBY]].

Oum passed away on February 1, 2015 due to severe allergic reaction.

title: makalov_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Makalov[/b] (マカロフ) is a playable character from [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]].

He is the older brother of [[marcia (fire emblem)|Marcia]], and a member of the Crimean Royal Knights, known for his lazy, self-indulgent behaviors, including drinking and gambling. This attracts the attention of [[Astrid (Fire Emblem)|]], who sees him as an exemplary knight by the time of [i]Radiant Dawn[/i].

title: bo-katan_kryze
body:
A fictional female character from [[Star Wars]]. She appears in [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]], [[Star Wars: Rebels]] and in [[The Mandalorian]].

[b]Bo-Katan Kryze[/b] is a red haired [[Mandalorian]] warrior woman. [spoiler]A former [[terrorist]] in her youth, she later radically changes her evil ways and becomes a good, just and capable leader of the Mandalorian people due to her royal heritage and vast battle experience.[/spoiler]

Played in both animated form and in live action by [[united_states|American]] actress "Katee Sackhoff":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katee_Sackhoff .

title: akuu_daisakusen_srungle
body:
[b]Srungle[/b], also known as [b]Military Operation in Subspace Srungle[/b] ([i]Akuu Daisakusen Srungle[/i]), is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime show that aired from 1983 until 1984 and ran for a total of 53 episodes. It is also known in the west as [b]Gorilla Force[/b] and as [b]Grupo Especial GORILA[/b] ([b]Special Group GORILLA[/b]) in Latin America, where it was broadcasted in 1991.

The show was created by MIC (Movie International Company) who also created [[uchuu_senshi_baldios|Baldios]], the [[J9 Series]] and [[makyou_densetsu_acrobunch|Acrobunch]] to name a few.

Srungle was based on the famous American spy television series "Mission Impossible":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mission:_Impossible which also aired in Japan years before.

h4. Intro Theme 1 - Mission Outer Space

* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qK_pDGzJubo

h4. Intro Theme 2 - Fighting On!

* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Nuw4_6Id-M

h4. See also

* [[srungle_(mecha)|Srungle]]
* [[jet_(srungle)|Jet]]
* [[sexy_(srungle)|Sexy]]
* [[dolly_(srungle)|Dolly]]
other_names: 亜空大作戦スラングル

title: arurandeisu_(old_design)
body:
The original form of [[Holostars]]' [[Arurandeisu]], as seen in post #3887011 and used until October 2022. 

He was portrayed with an [[old man|old]] appearance, with [[dark skin]], [[white hair]] and [[goatee]], [[glasses]], and [[grey eyes]].

His initial outfit consists of a [[green jacket|green]] [[double-breasted]] jacket, [[black shirt]], [[white pants]], [[white necktie|white]] [[print necktie]], [[black footwear|black leather shoes]], and a [[wristwatch]].

He also had an alternate version of his main outfit (post #3972869) that features a [[white jacket|white]] version of his jacket, a [[black coat|black]] overcoat, [[aiguillette]], [[sunglasses]], a [[rose]] pinned to the left side of his jacket, and a [[white headwear|white hat]].

title: nian_(mythology)
body:
A Nian is a [[Chinese mythology]] beast that lives under the sea or in the mountains. Once each spring, around [[Chinese New Year]], it comes out of hiding to attack people, destroy crops and eat animals and children. People have discovered its fear of loud noises, fire, and the colour red. Many [[Chinese New Year]] traditions, such as [[lion dance]], blowing up [[firecrackers]] and wearing and decorating with red are said to have originated from the legend of the Nian, and the practice of scaring it away.

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nian

title: lion_dance
body:
The lion dance is a a form of traditional dance in Chinese culture and other Asian countries in which performers mimic a lion's movements in a lion costume to bring good luck and fortune. It is is usually performed on big occasions such as cultural and religious festivals, important occasions such as business opening events, special celebrations or wedding ceremonies and notably the [[Chinese New Year]].

The [i]lion dance[/i] is sometimes mistakenly referred to as [[dragon dance]]. An easy way to tell the difference is that a lion is normally operated by only one or two dancers and has a tail, while a dragon is longer and needs many people holding a stick. See post #5041424 for comparison.

h4. Examples

* post #2620242
* post #3805167
* post #4353890
* post #4128851
* post #4565516

h4. See also

* [[shishimai]], Japanese Lion Dance.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: Lion Dance":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lion_dance

title: mab_pa-15
body:
The [B]MAB PA-15[/b] ([i]Pistolet Automatique 15[/i]) is a 9×19mm [b][[handgun]][/b] of French origin, introduced in 1966. The number 15 refers to the standard magazine capacity. It is visually recognizable by its M1911-style trigger and Walther PP-like rounded external hammer.

This tag also applies to its minor 8-round smaller counterpart, the P-8.

title: chevrolet_caprice
body:
A full-size [[car]] produced by [[Chevrolet]] from 1965 to 1996, notably considered the most popular car in America during the 60s and 70s, seeing widespread use as [[taxi]]s and [[police car]]s throughout it's run.

From 1999 to 2017, the Caprice was brought back exclusively in the Middle East and Latin America as a rebadge of the [[Holden]] Statesman and Caprice models. From 2011 on the rebadged Holden Caprices were available in the United States, albeit exclusively as police cars.

title: millicent_(elden_ring)
body:
[b]Millicent[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She claims to be an offshoot or descendant of [[Malenia Blade of Miquella]], along with her four [[sisters]] - [[Mary Eldest Sister ]], [[Maureen Second Sister]], [[Amy Third Sister]] and [[Polyanna Youngest Sister]]. She is presumably the fourth sister, given the names of the others. [spoilers]A small rot bloom found beneath the Haligtree indicates there may have been another sister that came before her, which would make her the fifth instead.[/spoilers]

Millicent wields a [[sword|shamshir]], and wears light [[brown robe]]s, like her sisters. She has a golden [[prosthetic arm]], similar to Malenia, that the [[Tarnished (elden ring)|]] gives to her as a part of her quest.

title: impulse_gundam
body:
[b]ZGMF-X56S Impulse Gundam[/b]
One of ZAFT's Second Stage mobile suits. Piloted more famously by the, fittingly, impulsive [[Shinn Asuka]], the unit became known for [spoiler]destroying [[Kira Yamato]]'s [[Freedom Gundam]] - even if he miraculously survived the dangerous ordeal[/spoiler]. After Shinn receives the more powerful [[Destiny Gundam]], the Impulse is handed down to [[Lunamaria Hawke]].

The Impulse is analogous to Earth Alliance' older [[Strike Gundam]], due to the former also having different specialized backpacks for [[force impulse gundam|flight and high mobility]], [[sword impulse gundam|close-quarters power]] and [[blast impulse gundam|long-range fire support]], which matches those of the latter's own.

title: strike_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X105 Strike Gundam[/b]
One of the five Gundam types developed by the Earth Alliance, and the most versatile of the group. Despite being only armed with head mounted CIWS guns and two knives, it could be matched with different specialized backpacks for [[aile strike gundam|flight and high mobility]], [[sword strike gundam|close-quarters power]], [[launcher strike gundam|long-range fire support]] or a [[perfect strike gundam|combination of those three packs for an all-purpose configuration]]. As the only of the five units that wasn't stolen by ZAFT, it was primarily piloted by [[Kira Yamato]], usually against its sibling units. After Kira moves on to pilot the stolen [[Freedom Gundam]], the Strike was passed down to [[Mu La Flaga]].

title: the_slap
body:
A 2008 novel by Christos Tsiolkas following 8 characters' perspectives after a man controversially slaps someone else's child at a gathering. Later adapted into two different live action television series - an Australian production in 2011, and an American production in 2015.

The series is most notable for inspiring a parody segment in the Australian sketch comedy series [b]Open Slather[/b], titled [i]The Slap 2[/i], which features a man slapping multiple people in succession after the initial slap. The parody went on to become a [[meme]], seeing remixes and parodies of it's own throughout the internet.

title: red_hot_chili_peppers
body:
An American rock band formed in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]] in 1983. The band's current lineup consists of vocalist Anthony Kiedis, bassist Flea, drummer Chad Smith, and guitarist John Frusciante. 

The band's music incorporates elements of punk rock, funk, and psychedelic rock, among other genres, and they are known for their high-energy live performances. The Red Hot Chili Peppers have released numerous albums over the course of their career and have won multiple Grammy Awards. 

Some of their most popular songs include "Under the Bridge," "Scar Tissue," and "Californication."

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Red Hot Chili Peppers":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Hot_Chili_Peppers]

title: rage_against_the_machine
body:
An American rock band known for their politically charged and socially conscious music. The band was formed in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], in 1991 and consists of vocalist Zack de la Rocha, guitarist Tom Morello, bassist Tim Commerford, and drummer Brad Wilk.

Rage Against the Machine gained widespread recognition for their fusion of metal, funk, and hip-hop, creating a unique sound that incorporated elements of said genres. Their music often features powerful guitar riffs, energetic rhythms, and politically inspired lyrics delivered with intense vocal delivery by Zack de la Rocha, which contributes to their energetic live performances and impassioned stage presence.

Rage Against the Machine released their self-titled debut album in 1992, which included the hit single "Killing in the Name." Their subsequent albums, "Evil Empire" (1996), "The Battle of Los Angeles" (1999), and "Renegades" (2000), also received critical acclaim and commercial success.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Rage Against the Machine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rage_Against_the_Machine]

title: touhou_world_cup
body:
Annual international Touhou shooting game competition, first held in 2020 and held every year since. It is organized by members of the global Touhou gameplay community. Three teams from all around the world duke it out on Lunatic (and Extra) mode, playing live to either get the highest score ("[[scoring]]") or clear with the fewest mistakes ("survival") - potentially claiming the mythical LNN (Lunatic No Miss No Bomb) run. Often abbreviated as TWC. 

Since 2021, artists have joined the project to illustrate the matches, often highlighting the incredible achievements that happened during them or the overall gameplay of the category being showcased. 

h4. See also

* [[touhou]]
* [[gameplay_mechanics]]
* [[scoring]]
* [[gastari]]

title: arran_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and The Blade of Light]], [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]], and their remakes. In the former, he is mutually exclusive with [[Samson (Fire Emblem)|]] - the player cannot recruit both in a single playthrough.

In [i]Mystery[/i], Arran serves as the "[[Jagen (Fire Emblem)|]]" of the game, starting out as a powerful unit, but later loses his viability due to poor growths. This is explained in-game to be the result of a terminal illness, which he succumbs to and dies in the ending.

He has [[medum hair|medium]], [[blonde hair]], wears [[pink armor]] with [[spiked pauldrons]], and often holds a [[spear]], his weapon of choice.

title: samson_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Shadow Dragon and The Blade of Light]], [[Fire Emblem: Mystery of The Emblem]], and their remakes. In the former, he is mutually exclusive with [[Arran (Fire Emblem)|]] - the player cannot recruit both in a single playthrough.

In the sequel, he becomes a bodyguard under [[Sheena (Fire Emblem)|]]. Unlike the previous game, the player can have both Arran and Samson in their party.

He has [[blue hair]], wearing [[blue armor]] with [[spiked pauldrons]] to match, and often carries a large blue [[shield]]. Some artwork depicts him holding a [[sword]], his weapon of choice.

title: serana
body:
A female [[vampire]] from [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim]]. She is the central character of the vampire-themed [i]Dawnguard[/i] expansion and daughter of its antagonist, Lord Harkon. She accompanies the player character almost entirely throughout its story, regardless whether they chose to side with the vampires or vampire hunters.

Serana has stood out among Skyrim companions for having an extensive character arc and development, while frequently interacting with the player throughout the main quest, whereas the majority of the game's NPCs have comparatively flat personalities and basic character backgrounds. This has made her very popular among the Elder Scrolls community and a frequent subject of romantic interest for players, even though her relationship with the player is entirely platonic in the game (unless the option is modded in).

title: katakana
body:
[b]Katakana[/b] (片仮名、カタカナ; 片假名 in Chinese) are Japanese syllabic characters used along with hiragana and kanji to write Japanese. These days generally being used to write out loan words, among other more specialized uses compared to hiragana.

Due to how ubiquitous katakana is, this tag is useless.

title: hiragana
body:
[b]Hiragana[/b] (平仮名, ひらがな; 平假名 in Chinese) are Japanese syllabic characters used along with katakana and kanji to write Japanese.

Since almost all Japanese text will have hiragana, this tag is useless.

As a general rule, this tag should be used if a character's eyes take up half or more of the total area of their face.

A common trait of [[chibi]] characters, (traditional) shoujo manga and visual novel art styles and animes for children, thus might come along with [[anime coloring]].

They're also usually extra sparkly with intense highlights and eyelashes.

title: flora_(dq5)
body:
Flora is a character from [[Dragon Quest V]]. She is the daughter of a rich shipping magnate. After the hero completes some business for him, her father offers the hero her hand in marriage; the hero must then decide whether to marry Flora or his own childhood friend [[Bianca (dq5)|]] (or, in the [[Nintendo DS]] remake, the magnate's [i]other[/i] daughter [[Deborah (dq5)|]]).

Her name in the official English version of the DS port is [b]Nera[/b]; "Flora" comes from an earlier fan translation of the [i]DQV[/i] script, and is a more accurate representation of her name in katakana ("[i]Furora[/i]").

title: rosenkreuzstilette_freudenstachel
body:
Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel is a sequel to [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] that was released in October 2012, with [[Freudia Neuwahl]] as its protagonist. It takes place a few months after the events of the first game and the Church has started witch-hunting Magi, presumably in response to the holy war fought against them by RKS. In addition, a new mysterious organization called the Black Cross appears, made up entirely of Dark Magi, with a mysterious agenda.

A boss design contest was held, with five winning entries plus a special entry by [[Shizuku (artist)|]] named [[Strudel]], who is Freudia's [[fairy]] partner rather than a boss.

title: doris_warmind
body:
Doris is a newcomer to RKS making her appearance in [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] Freudenstachel. She is [[ninja]]-esque in appearance and wears pink [[headphones]], and carries a large, over-sized shuriken, her Fesselspirale, whith ease thanks to her incredible strength despite her outer appearance. She is the leader of the RKS Special Ops Unit, one of three different portions of RKS (the others being the RKS Intelligence Unit, whom Karl Palesch works for, and the RKS Strike Force, led by [[Sichte Meister]]). She is calm in the heat of battle but can be careless and reckless most of the time. She is a hard worker and hates to lose. She's very intelligent yet knows very little about the outside world. She is also easily jealous. She also hates being called small, judging by her small size and the others being taller than her.

Her weapon, the Fesselspirale that she wields, allows her to gather wind power from the objects around her into it, which she can throw like a boomerang. Her Fesselspirale arcs in a fashion normally impossible.

Doris was designed by [[Hissatsukun]]. She is one of the winning entries of a boss design contest for Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel so far, the others being [[Pamela Arwig]], who was designed by [[alphes]], [[Eifer Skute]], who was designed by [[Aburidashi Zakuro]], [[Schirach Fuhler|Schirach Fühler]], who was designed by [[daddy_(dadi)|Daddy (Tatei)]], and [[Lecht Refraktia|Lecht]] and [[Rink Refraktia]], who were both designed by [[REDMOON]].

title: hissatsukun
body: The designer of the [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]] boss [[Doris Warmind]].

title: lecht_refraktia
body:
Lecht Refraktia is the older sister of [[Rink Refraktia|Rink]], both of whom are twin [[nun|nuns]] always seen together, rarely apart. She is very introverted and doesn't like talking to others. She is [[blind]] in one eye, thus wearing an [[eyepatch]], and absolutely loves to read books.

Both of the Refraktia twins share the same weapon, which is Falschegestalt, which allows them to create a magical shield that reflects projectiles.

The Refraktia twins were designed by [[REDMOON]]. They are one of the winning entries of a boss design contest for Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel so far, the others being [[Pamela Arwig]], who was designed by [[alphes]], [[Eifer Skute]], who was designed by [[Aburidashi Zakuro]], [[Schirach Fuhler|Schirach Fühler]], who was designed by [[daddy_(dadi)|Daddy (Tatei)]], and [[Doris Warmind]], who was designed by [[Hissatsukun]].

title: rink_refraktia
body:
Rink Refraktia is the younger sister of [[Lecht Refraktia|Lecht]], both of whom are twin [[nun|nuns]] always seen together, rarely apart. She is a lively, outgoing girl who foremost keeps her sister in her thoughts. Should Lecht be endangered, Rink will do anything to remove the threat.

Both of the Refraktia twins share the same weapon, which is Falschegestalt, which allows them to create a magical shield that reflects projectiles.

The Refraktia twins were designed by [[REDMOON]]. They are one of the winning entries of a boss design contest for Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel so far, the others being [[Pamela Arwig]], who was designed by [[alphes]], [[Eifer Skute]], who was designed by [[Aburidashi Zakuro]], [[Schirach Fuhler|Schirach Fühler]], who was designed by [[daddy_(dadi)|Daddy (Tatei)]], and [[Doris Warmind]], who was designed by [[Hissatsukun]].

title: eifer_skute
body:
Eifer is a Dark Magus and member of the Black Cross organization in [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] Freudenstachel. Easily noticeable by the heavy clothes she always wears thanks to her hypothermia, Eifer is very cool-headed and mature for her young age. However, she can sometimes act out of character thanks to her violently fluctuating emotions and mood, but she seems to carry strong emotions towards [[Freudia Neuwahl]] for some unknown reason.

Her weapon is Eiferstachel, which allows her to manipulate the location, density, and hardness of the objects around her and use them to attack. She can turn earthly metals and flora into dangerous weapons to use in an instant.

Eifer was designed by [[Aburidashi Zakuro]] (zaku6). She is one of the winning entries of a boss design contest for Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel so far, the others being [[Pamela Arwig]], who was designed by [[alphes]], [[Schirach Fuhler|Schirach Fühler]], who was designed by [[daddy_(dadi)|Daddy (Tatei)]], [[Lecht Refraktia|Lecht]] and [[Rink Refraktia]], who were both designed by [[REDMOON]], and [[Doris Warmind]], who was designed by [[Hissatsukun]].

title: pamela_arwig
body:
Pamela Arwig is the captain of an organization of Dark Magi known as the Black Cross, the main antagonizing group of [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]]. Born of nobility, she was secretly trained as a royal [[knight]]. She is fairly mysterious, so her origins and motives as well as her existence are best kept secret. Therefore, very little is known about her. She's fairly straightforward and sensible, and she never doubts her views of justice. On the other hand, she will convict those who do not share her thoughts with her.

Her weapon is a magical [[rapier]] called Weißsilber. Using it, she can draw a [[magic circle]] in the air, manipulating the space within. With this, many attacks are available for her use.

Pamela was designed by [[alphes]]. She is one of the winning entries of a boss design contest for Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel so far, the others being [[Eifer Skute]], who was designed by [[Aburidashi Zakuro]], [[Schirach Fuhler|Schirach Fühler]], who was designed by [[daddy_(dadi)|Daddy (Tatei)]], [[Lecht Refraktia|Lecht]] and [[Rink Refraktia]], who were both designed by [[REDMOON]], and [[Doris Warmind]], who was designed by [[Hissatsukun]].

title: route_66
body:
A historic [[united states|American]] highway that traversed eight states and extended from Chicago, Illinois to Santa Monica, California. The highway and the idyllic towns it passed through have been immortalized in popular culture as a part of American nostalgia. 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Route 66":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Route_66]

title: san_francisco
body:
A major city located on the west coast of the [[United States]] in the state of [[California]]. It is known for its stunning natural beauty, iconic landmarks, diverse culture, and vibrant atmosphere. San Francisco is situated on a peninsula between the Pacific Ocean and the San Francisco Bay, with the [[Golden Gate Bridge]] being one of its most famous symbols.

The city's history dates back to its founding in 1776 by Spanish colonists. It played a significant role in the California Gold Rush of the mid-19th century, which led to rapid growth and development. Today, San Francisco is a global hub for technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship, home to numerous tech companies, startups, and venture capital firms.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: San Francisco":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Francisco]
* "Wikipedia: California":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California]
* "Wikipedia: United States of America":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_of_America]

title: california
body:
A state in the Pacific region of the [[United states|United States]] with a total area of approximately 163,696 square miles and a population of over 39.3 million, making it the most populous and third largest state in the United States by area. Known for its diverse geography, vibrant cities, and cultural influence, California plays a significant role in various industries, including entertainment, technology, agriculture, and tourism.

The name "California" originates from the Spanish colonial era when the region was claimed by Spanish explorers. It was later part of [[Mexico]] before becoming a U.S. territory in 1847 and achieving statehood in 1850.

The state of California is home to several major cities, mainly [[Los Angeles]], [[San Francisco]], San Diego, and Sacramento (the state capital).

California is celebrated for its contributions to the entertainment industry, with Hollywood being the center of the American film and television industry. 

It is also home to the Silicon Valley in the southern part of the San Francisco Bay Area. It is renowned as a global hub for technology and innovation, housing numerous high-tech companies, startups, venture capital firms, and research institutions.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: California":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/California]
* "Wikipedia: United States of America":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_of_America]

title: angry_birds
body:
[i]Angry Birds[/i] is an application for the [[iphone|iOS]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] Phone, Bada, Symbian, webOS, Android and Maemo mobile operating systems. It was released by Rovio Entertainment and made in Helsinki, Finland. The objective of the game is to eliminate the [[Bad Piggies]] and destroy their buildings and structures at the same time. This is done by the birds launching themselves out of a giant [[slingshot (weapon)|]] and hitting the pigs' various constructs, henceforth eliminating them. Each level allots the player a certain number of birds, which must be used in the order provided.

title: azure_striker_gunvolt
body:
[b][i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i][/b] (Japanese title: 蒼き雷霆ガンヴォルト, pronounced as アームドブルー・ガンヴォルト, Armed Blue Gunvolt) is an action side-scrolling platforming developed by "Inti Creates":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inti_Creates with some input from "Keiji Inafune":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keiji_Inafune, and it is Inti Creates' first independent video game series. The series serves as a spiritual successor to the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series.

The game takes place in a distant future where those born with psychic powers known as "Adapts" (EN) / "Seventh" (JP) are feared and oppressed on a regular basis by those without. A major world-wide conglomerate known as the Sumuragi Group tasked themselves into bringing peace to Adapts under their "Psychic Protection" program, but unbeknownst to the world, their so-called plan for peace turned out to be what amounts to concentration camps where a series of cruel and inhumane experiments are performed on Adapts under their program. A resistance group known as QUILL (EN) / FEATHER (JP) however surfaced in attempt to stop their atrocities. One of their newest members, a 14-year-old Adapt boy known only by his codename, "[[Gunvolt]]", who also possesses the titular "Azure Striker" (EN) / "Armed Blue" (JP) septima, the ability to control electricity and lightning. During one mission where Gunvolt is tasked to stop Sumuragi's plans to steal the cyber diva [[lumen_(gunvolt)|Lumen]] (EN) / Morpho (JP) and her septima of "The Muse" to control Adapts across the world then destroy her, Gunvolt however he discovers that the cyber diva was not a computer programmed idol, but rather the manifestation of a young girl's septimal powers named [[joule_(gunvolt)|Joule]] (EN) / Cyan (JP). Not wishing to see Joule suffer through the same kind of oppression he went through, Gunvolt boldly went against his orders and rescues her from her captors.

The series later gained a sequel, [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 2[/i], which takes place a few months after the events of its predecessor, where Gunvolt crosses paths with an Adapt-hunting avenger named [[acura_(gunvolt)|Copen]] (EN) / Acura (JP) from the previous game as they encounter a group of Adapts known as Eden, whom harbor a hatred towards humans, seeking to use Joule's powers to wipe out humans and create a new utopia for Adapts. A gaiden game, [i][[gunvolt_chronicles_luminous_avenger_ix|Gunvolt Chronicles: Luminous Avenger iX]][/i], later follows after the events of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 1[/i] and focuses on Copen. There are also supplementary materials that expands on the serie's world and characters, such as [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt: Fleeting Memories[/i], prequel story taking place before the first game, as well as an OVA based on the first game released through the Nintendo 3DS eShop. Gunvolt also made an appearance in [i][[Mighty Gunvolt]][/i], a retro-inspired spin-off series of games also from Inti Creates that features a cross-over of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt[/i], [i][[Mighty No. 9]][/i], and [i][[gal_gun|Gal☆Gun]][/i]. The series gains a third game in [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 3[/i], set years after the events of [i]Azure Striker Gunvolt 2[/i].

h4.Characters

title: b&t_apc
body:
The [b]B&T APC[/b] (Advanced Police Carbine) is a family of [[gun|firearms]] of Swiss origin, produced and manufactured by B&T (formerly known as Brügger & Thomet) of Switzerland. Announced in 2011, this series of [[submachine gun]] uses standard 9×19mm (APC9), .40 S&W (APC40), 10mm Auto (APC10) and .45 ACP (APC45) [[ammunition]].

The APC series was designed in the 2000s, as a modern SMG that would be cheaper to produce than the compact [[assault rifle]]s that were seeing an increase in [[military]] usage during this period. The APC uses a straight blowback gas system. The [[weapon]] use the same [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]] as the [[b&t mp9|MP9]].

h1. See also
* [[B&T APC556]]
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "B&T APC":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brügger_%26_Thomet_APC]

title: eurovision_song_contest
body:
Song contest organized annually by the European Broadcasting Union in collaboration with the the countries whose broadcasters are in the union, largely based in Europe. Held since 1956, developed as a way to take advantage of live television broadcasting and a way to produce cheaper programming for national broadcasting organizations. Related to it is the defunct Intervision Song Contest, held in Eastern Europe from 1965 to 1980, as a competitor to the Western European Eurovision.

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Eurovision Song Contest":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurovision_Song_Contest]

title: tone_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
[[Tone (kancolle)|]]'s second remodel/kai ni.

After upgrade, she has a much more visually distinct appearance, wearing a shorter [[green jacket]], a long black skirt with such extreme side slits as to make it a pelvic curtain, and no visible underwear. Although as revealed in the supplementary material for the [[Kantai Collection (Anime)|2016 animated film]], she wears some form of extremely [[highleg panties]], the straps being high enough to hide under her jacket.

title: navigator_(7th_dragon)
body: The Navigation Operator, or [i]Navigator[/i], can be one of two genetically modified twins in Murakumo, a [[Miina (7th dragon)|girl (NAV 3.7)]] or [[Miroku (7th dragon)|boy (NAV 3.6)]]. They are your guide in both [[7th Dragon 2020]] and its sequel, [[7th Dragon 2020-II]].

title: 7th_dragon_2020-ii
body:
A direct sequel to [[7th Dragon 2020]], which takes place after a year after the first game. It was released on April 18, 2013 in Japan for the PlayStation Portable.
[[Hatsune Miku]] once again appears as an NPC, along with the DIVA mode. This game features a new class, Idol.

h4. Classes

Each class has 3 male and 3 female appearances with 3 different color palettes for each appearance.

* [[Destroyer (7th dragon 2020)|]]
* [[Hacker (7th dragon)|]] 
* [[Psychic (7th dragon)|]] 
* [[Samurai (7th dragon series)|]] 
* [[Trickster (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Lucier (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Idol (7th dragon)|]] (Exclusive)

h4. NPC Characters

* [[Ayafumi Kirino]]
* [[Navigator (7th dragon)|]] ([[Miina (7th dragon)|]] / [[Miroku (7th dragon)|]])
* [[Furusuga Cheron]]
* [[Doujima Rin]]
* [[Reimi (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Keima (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Waji (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Miya (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Tomagi Shizuka]]
* [[Emel (7th Dragon)|]]
* [[Marina (7th dragon 2020-ii)|]]

h6. SKY members

* [[Neko (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Daigo (7th dragon)|]]

title: 7th_dragon_2020
body:
A spin-off game of [[7th Dragon]], was released in Japan on November 23, 2011 for the PlayStation Portable.

[[Hatsune Miku]] appeared as an official collaboration character of the game, appearing in the opening theme song sequence, as well as the voice provider for optional DIVA Mode remixed songs.

It has a sequel called [[7th dragon 2020-II]].

h4. Classes

Each class has a male and female appearance.

* [[Destroyer (7th dragon 2020)|]] / [[Nishimura Haru (7th dragon)|]] (Destroyer Female 1st appearance)
* [[Hacker_(7th_dragon)|]] / [[Chelsea (7th dragon)|]] (Hacker Female 1st appearance)
* [[Samurai (7th dragon series)|]] / [[Katanako]] (Samurai Female 1st appearance)
* [[Psychic (7th dragon)|]] 
* [[Trickster (7th dragon)|]]
* [[Lucier (7th dragon)|]]

h4. NPC Characters

title: metnal
body:
A fictional [[alien]] planet from the [[Karmatron y los Transformables]]  [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] Mexican comic series from the 80s.

Planet [b]Metnal[/b] is an ancient, very dark and sinister looking planet located in the far reaches of the universe. It is home to the Metnal people, an evil militaristic culture who promoted war and conflict through the cosmos. 

It is the home planet of the evil emperor [[Asura (karmatron)|]]. The emblem of the Metnal people is a red inverted triangle symbol.

In [[real life]] the name "Metnal" was used by the [[maya_(culture)|Mayans]] to refer to the ninth level of [[hell]], which was considered the most sinister of them all.

title: people's_liberation_army_navy
body:
The naval warfare service branch of the [[People's Liberation Army]].

Up until the early 2000s, the PLAN is mainly a coastal defense force with antique equipment. It underwent massive overhaul and modernization of equipment and training since 2008 and later became the second largest navy in the world, after the [[United States Navy]].
